Oregon, told the Washington Post that the timing of Gabrielle Giffords opening her eyes was a good sign and sees a positive prognosis for the Congresswoman. "It's very significant," told the Post. In someone like her, who in just a few days after injury is opening her eyes and following commands, it is a much better prognostic indicator of recovery. It's less meaningful when it happens three or six months later. wake of the Tucson tragedy, politicians from both sides of the aisle have called for a more civil discourse in our political debate. On CBS's Face the Nation this morning, John McCain ( R-AZ) said, There is a lack of respect in our dialogue.... We shouldn't mistake passion for advocacy. In other words, passion is necessary in this debate that we're having, but we've got to make sure it doesn't spill over into personal attacks and impugning people's character or patriotism.
